name: Country Inn Corbett

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were rat droppings on our pillows. It's supposed to be a higher end resort and it's not. The food is mediocre. The service is adequate. Overall it was a poor experience. We had our guide Ramesh Suyal arrange this stay for us so if you are thinking about hiring him, please tell him that you want to stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Rat Droppings on the Pillows

reviews.text: When we got to our "deluxe" room, it smelled of something very strange indeed ... we had to call in the housekeeping to spray some freshner ...
reviews.title: A good experience overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, except for this one aberration, everything else turned out to be better than expected ... the hotel's in the forest and that sets the ambience and they arrange for a lot of fun outings / activities such as river crossing, wall climbing, fishing etc. They do arrange for hot air baloon rides as well - we didn't go for it though ... The hotel is also within easy reach of the park gates (for the morning safari) as well as in drivable distance of a nice picture perfect waterfall
reviews.title: Living in Nature's Lap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The campus is well laid out and welcoming ... the food is good and in campus recreation such as bonfire music, swings and swimming pool are good
reviews.title: Heavenly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very beautiful property with large and spacious rooms. Great food on offer with almost all amenities like swimming pool, spa, children play area, gardens, sports room etc.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 nights and 4 days X mas package from Country Inn. Our dates of stay were from 24th December, 08 to 27th December, 08. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. The service provided by the hotel had a personal touch. We were looked after well by the staff, right from the day we checked in.
reviews.title: Splendid!!

description: This beautiful jungle resort is well located in the Dhikuli area of Jim Corbett National Park (On the Ranikhet National Highway). The resort is a 2 minute walk from the banks of river Kosi adjoining the core areas of the Jim Corbett National Park. The resort is spread across 3.4 acres of beautiful gardens and is dotted with tall fruit bearing mango trees all across. The rooms and layout of the resort gives the feel of the Jungle lodges of the colonial era and gets you close to nature. The resort offers a wide range of cuisines including local favorites, Indian delicacies and international favorites making it an ideal destination for your jungle holiday. The fun games, activities and adventure available in this region combine to make your holiday filled with many thrills one seeks while in the wilderness. Country Inn resorts are pet friendly.
